abstract:
Style guides are a key tool for many documentarians — they guarantee
consistency, streamline onboarding, and even improve the documentation
non- technical writers create.

Whether you're creating an internal style guide or a commercially
available reference, though, there are plenty of pitfalls. In this talk,
we'll cover:

-  style guide assumptions (and how to avoid them)
-  jargon, slang, idioms, and other words with multiple meanings
-  inclusion, sensitivity readings, and generally making sure you know
   how other people hear terms
-  teaching style across a team
title: What They Don't Tell You About Creating New Style Guides
